intro: Saxifraga × karacardica, commonly known as the Karacardic saxifrage, is a hybrid plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Its leaves are usually basal, with a broad, slightly lobed shape, and are covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Saxifraga × karacardica is often cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
